results.title: South Pacific island children: life in Fiji
results.brief_description: Family life on one of the largest islands of the Fiji Group. Shows members of a native family at a variety of daily activities - fishing, gardening, attending school and constructing a house. Also indicates the importance of the coconut palm to the islanders and shows a fish drive followed by a feast.

results.title: South Pacific (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Buddy Adler, S P Enterprises and Magna Corporation
results.brief_description: Tender romance, an immortal score and enchanted South Seas splendour are set against the dark backdrop of a world war, in this lush and passionate musical classic. The score is as breathtaking as the South Seas setting - “Some enchanted evening”, “Bali Hai”, “There is nothing like a dame”, “Younger than springtime”, and many more. Winner of the Pulitzer Prize, “South Pacific” ranks among the most celebrated of Rodgers and Hammerstein’s acclaimed musical masterpieces. Stars Mitzi Gaynor, Rossano Brazzi, John Kerr, Ray Walston, France Nuyen and Juanita Hall as Bloody Mary.

results.title: South of the Border
results.brief_description: Music is an important part of the lives of Latin Americans, closely linked to the expression of their personal and political feelings, hopes and aspirations. In Central America, where the press is censored, and the radio and TV gagged; the U.S.-backed regimes have failed to stop the music. Although the penalties for singing the wrong song can be jail or death, the music goes on. This video is a powerful musical tour which starts in Cuba, and moves to Mexico, Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador. Narrated by Midnight Oil’s Peter Garrett, the film is a moving testament to the bravery and courage of those who pursue freedom.

results.title: South of France
results.brief_description: A practical guide for people intending to travel the South of France. Host John Guerassio begins in the Provence region, visiting Avignon, Arles, Camarge, Stes-Maries-De-La-Mer, Vaucluse, and Gard. From here he travels to the French Riviera to appraise Nice, Cannes, Mougins, St Paul, Biot, St Raphael, St Tropez and Pramousquier. He recommends quiet and remote beaches in the region for those wishing to escape the crowds. Provides advice on public transport options, budget and deluxe hotels, money saving tips, food and wine. Includes shopping advice for antiques, lace and hand blown glass.

results.title: South Mysore
results.creator_credit: AMA and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: An American family holidaying in Bangalor and the surrounding district. The tourist facilities; Mysore City; the palaces, markets and temples; street entertainers, formal gardens, festivals, visits to game reserves; the Jain monuments; local customs and folk dances.

results.title: South India
results.creator_credit: Jez Higham, Emma Cahwac and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Justine Shapiro explores India’s southern tip, travelling through the state of Tamil Nadu, and then on to tropical Kerala where she tours its famed network of backwaters and canals. Justine ends her journey on the rarely visited Lakshadweep islands in the middle of the Arabian Sea. Other activities covered in the journey include: eating at a vegetarian restaurant where 3,000 customers lunch everyday, riding on a bullock cart to a Hindu temple at Tiravanamali, travelling to an elephant sanctuary and bathing them, and visiting one of India’s few female gurus who has hugged over ten million people.

results.title: South East Asia
results.brief_description: A survey of the industry and commerce of Burma, Indo-China, Thailand and Malaya where ancient methods and modes of life contrast sharply with new machinery, schools, highways, modern factories and scientific farming methods. Explains that rice is the basic food crop of the area, and it is also exported in quantities to other countries. Other products include tin, oil, crude rubber and teak.

results.title: South Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Visit the rich, fertile Barossa Valley, trek into the outback, enjoy the spectacular view from Mt Lofty House in the Adelaide Hills beautifully restored after the 1983 Ash Wednesday bush fires, visit the Gawler Ranges and the seaside town of Victor Harbour, charter a yacht at Port Lincoln, explore the heritage buildings in the mining town of Burra, journey by train from Adelaide to Alice Springs on the legendary Ghan, stay in an underground hotel in the opal mining town of Coober Pedy and finally enjoy a boat trip at Coorong.
